text:
Each of the four possible ending wealth values has a 25% probability, so the expected
ending wealth is simply (4,000 + 1,000 + 1,000 + 250)/4 = $1,562.50, or 0.25(4,000)
+ 0.50(1,000) + 0.25(250) = $1,562.50. This is consistent with earning a compound
annual rate of return equal to the arithmetic mean of 25%, 1.252 x $1,000 = $1,562.50,
but not with earning the geometric mean return of 0%. For each single year, the
expected rate of return is simply the average of +100% and -50% since those outcomes
are equally likely.
